result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nole J Schweich

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nole J Schweich in court.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee appeared by video for Nole J Schweich. 
Justice Programs Coordinator Shanda Harrington appears in court.

2:48  Court relates and gives appearances.
$50 diversion court fee has been paid.
20 hrs of Comm. Service work is complete.
2:50  Atty. Caffee relates.  Restorative Justice is complete.
2:50  Court questions Nole.
2:51  State moves to dismiss case; Court grants motion.
2:52  Mr. Schweich indicates what he learned from being in diversion court.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on May 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

Must have no contact with H. L. B., dob: 09/04/88.

03/29/2022 AMENDED: COURT MODIFIES THE NO CONTACT WITH H.L.B. PROVISION FROM NO CONTACT TO ALLOW FOR CONTACT, THOUGH NON ABUSIVE CONTACT, FOR PURPOSE OF CHILD EXCHANGE ONLY.

04/20/2022 MODIFIED TO MUST HAVE NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH H. L. B., DOB: 09/04/88.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

10:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nole J Schweich appeared by video.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee appeared by video for Nole J Schweich.
State presents diversion court agreement. Defendant to appear in person for next date. Attorney Caffee may appear by zoom. Court modifies bond to no abusive contact. Defendant instructed to come to Clerk of Court office to sign new bond.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nole J Schweich appeared by video.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee appeared by video for Nole J Schweich. 
Request to amend bond to must have no contact except for communication regarding the children/ 3 party exchanges  . No objection to 3rd party exchanges. 
Court grants requested modification. 

The no contact provision shall be amended to allow for contact though non abusive contact for purpose of child exchange only.
